channel.title: Changing the Quest tab [PI]

item.title: Changing the Quest tab [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Considering I’m the only Staff. They might want to ask me a question or report. And trust me, in just about any server people always want to know when the owner is online.

Yeah, they want to know if you’re online or not so they can ask if they can be an Administrator. I’m pretty sure I’ve been around R.S.P.S. longer than you have, so I don’t trust anything you say. Good luck with your problem though, and being the only “Staff” member, I’m out.

EDIT: I’m sorry, I’ve put up with a TON of bullshit today. Here, add my Skype and I’ll help you: SpecialAgentJackBower

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the Quest tab [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

It’d be better if you made it open a website via Client, you can still put in the Quest tab. You want players to know if you’re online or offline? You could put that in the login method I guess… Pretty useless and stupid though. Your players don’t care if you’re on or not, they’ll just know that you’re an egomaniac.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the Quest tab [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

So I have a few things I’d love to do to my quest tab.
1: Make it display my name in green or red whether I’m offline(red) or online(green)

[code]if (playerName.equals(“Abstract”)) {
getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@Abstract", 29162);
}
else
{
getPA().sendFrame126("@red@Abstract", 29162);

}[/code]
That’s what I have now and it doesn’t work correctly.

2: Make a button to link it to my forums.

That’s what I have now, I don’t know how to make it open a website through clickingbuttons.java

That is all that I can tell. Thanks for anyones help.

Read full topic
